title: Dedication to Zeus and Tyche
support: A white limestone altar, finished with a claw chisel on all four sides, with inscription on the front face, a relief of an eagle standing on a thunderbolt on the reverse, mouldings on all four sides form the base and the upper register. The altar is broken/damaged across the top

layout.p: The inscribed field is H 26.5 x W 32.7 with three lines of Greek text

handNote.lettering: Carefully carved letters, with minimal use of serifs, most visible on tau and chi; the iota adscript at the end of line 2 is small and mid-line; omicron is rhomboid in form, the hastae of the mu are all angled.

date._: Later first century BCE or earlier first century CE

provenanceFound._: Found in excavations in the Giardino Spagna necropolis (area of the Umberto I hospital), Siracusa, in 1943; exact findspot not currently localised

provenanceObserved._: 2006.07 by Prag and checked 2013.09.30, 2017.03.24, on display in sector D

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
museum.description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.
